<JD_START>
Job Title: Chief Accounting Officer

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
TALTRAN Global has been exclusively retained by an established manufacturing company to recruit a top-tier Chief Accounting Officer (CAO). Renowned for its cutting-edge technology and commitment to product quality, this company has solidified its position as a leader in the aviation sector, working primarily on aviation component manufacturing. With an unwavering dedication to excellence in financial management and adherence to regulatory standards, their primary focus is on enhancing operational efficiency and financial resilience to drive global success within the manufacturing space.
ResponsibilitiesOversee and manage the operations and personnel of the accounting department, including the design of an organizational structure adequate for achieving the department’s goals and objectives.Assessing current accounting operations, offering recommendations for improvement and implementing new processesServe as the internal lead for annual financial audits, and other audit activityProvide status of financial condition by collecting, interpreting, and reporting financial dataPrepares special reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trendsCreate, document, and maintain accounting policies and procedures to ensure that all internal controls are adequate and protect company assetsGuide financial decisions by monitoring and enforcing policies and proceduresAssist Chief Financial Officer in special projects and other duties as necessaryPartnering with the CFO to determine accounting implications for all material business decisions;Reviewing all documentation and contracts in order to develop and improve internal controls;Managing transaction accounting, the closing process, and other financial controls.Overseeing General Ledger functions; assure accuracy, timeliness, and conformity with professional accounting standards and best practices in accordance with GAAP. RequirementsBachelor’s degree in Accounting3-5 years in Public Accounting – Big Four PreferredActive CPA licenseMinimum of 5+ years of experience in a senior financial leadership positionExperience in the manufacturing industryUS GAAP knowledgeMulti entity – multi currency consolidation experienceExperience with NetSuite strongly preferredLiaise with functional leaders throughout the organizationConsistent, accurate, and thorough with an eye for detailsOutstanding communication skills, written and verbalAble to thrive in a deadline-driven environmentAble to motivate the team and lead by example

Experience Level (if available): Executive
<JD_END>
